gmmaker > statePhysics

statePhysics 

interface statePhysics

This is where map platforms and joints are stored.

Summary

Public Properties

bro gmm.d.ts:702 
bro: number[]

number[]

Likely stands for "body (platform) render order".

As the name may suggest, this is an array that determines the order at which platforms are rendered.

Each item contains a platform ID: the first platform in the list is the one that gets rendered first (and as such is the farthest platform from the camera) and the last platform in the list is the one that renders last (and as such is the nearest platform).

joints gmm.d.ts:696 
joints: joint[]

joint[]

Array that contains the definitions of every joint in the world.

Ordered by ID (joints[0] is joint with ID 0, joints[2] is joint with ID 2, etc.)

platforms gmm.d.ts:687 
platforms: platformList

platformList

Array that contains the definitions of every platform in the world.

Ordered by ID (platform[0] is platform with ID 0, platform[2] is platform with ID 2, etc.)

NOTE: This is not an ordinary array! You can't manually add or remove platforms from this object. You must use the game.world.createPlatform and game.world.removePlatform methods.

ppm gmm.d.ts:712 
ppm: number

number

Likely stands for "pixels per meter". It determines the size of the map: bigger ppm, smaller map.

Despite the name, a ppm of 1 will not make every meter a screen pixel wide, instead it will make them around 1.5 pixels wide due to an internal parameter called "scale ratio" that assures an optimal resolution according to the client's display size.
